column5: YOU WILL FIND in the DIARIES a LOT of POLITICS AND EVEN MORE CATS     THE PERSON who MAKES the FIRST COMMENT WILL GET TWO CATS EVERY PERSON WHO COMMENTS WILL GET A CAT     RULES IN THE DIARY WHEN YOU FIND SOMETHING in the DIARY that you LIKE YOU CAN REPOST IT AS COMMENT in the DIARY  PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN President Biden announced eight new federal judicial nominations today as the White House seeks to maintain its rapid pace of nominations — and confirmations — to the federal bench.The announcement marks Biden's fifth wave of judicial nominees. https://t.co/TJjx4lBh0H  President Biden is raising wages for federal firefighters to no less than $15 an hour. https://t.co/hl1j6m0adh  BARACK OBAMA Obama: "The guardrails I thought were in place around many of our democratic institutions really depend on the two parties agreeing to those ground rules ... One of them right now doesn't seem as committed to them.""And I think we should all be worried." https://t.co/t50UU995ry  GLADYS SICKNICK "Donald Trump did not stop the insurrection" Gladys Sicknick mother of fallen Capitol Officer Brian Sicknick says. "He was the person who could have stopped that whole thing right from the get-go and he did not." https://t.co/ZoBedAIfbD  ADAM KINZINGER Republican Rep. Adam Kinzinger says he will vote for the Jan. 6 Select Committee.  HOUSE RULES CHAIR MCGOVERN House Rules Chair McGovern: "Looking down on us from the gallery right now are representatives of the D.C. Metro Police and the U.S. Capitol Police ... To my colleagues on the other side of the aisle about to vote 'no' on this please no lectures on respect for the police."  LIZ CHENEY New from Liz Cheney:"Our nation and the families of the brave law enforcement officers who were injured defending us or died following the attack deserve answers. I believe this select committee is our only remaining option. I will vote to support it."  House Democratic Caucus Chair Jeffries House Democratic Caucus Chair Jeffries: "The radical right consistently claims to be the party of law and order but they refuse to sign off on an investigation into the January 6 violent attack on the Capitol which embodied lawlessness and disorder."  NANCY PELOSI Pelosi: "Many across the aisle refuse to admit the truth. They refuse to admit the truth when they voted against certifying the president ... They refuse to admit the truth when they call that day a normal tourist visit. And today ... they will again refuse to admit this truth."  HOUSE RULES CHAIR MCGOVERN AGAIN House Rules Chair McGovern: "I was hoping that maybe the Minority Leader would come to the floor and explain to us why he objected to the bipartisan commission. Why he objects to the select committee. Why he objects to getting to the truth. But apparently he's not coming."  BREAKING:WASHINGTON (AP) -- House approves select committee to investigate Jan. 6 attack on US Capitol with nearly all Republicans voting against.  Just *two* Republicans Just *two* Republicans — Cheney and Kinzinger — joined every Democrat in supporting the resolution to establish a Jan. 6 select committee.  WISCONSIN Gov. Tony Evers has vetoed a bill Republicans and the state's largest business lobby have pushed for weeks that would eliminate additional unemployment benefits for Wisconsinites who lost work during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/mHH9DHa51p  TRUMP Breaking WSJ: The Manhattan district attorney's office is expected to charge the Trump Organization and its chief financial officer with tax-related crimes on Thursday people familiar with the matter said.https://t.co/jmOPlqLbcU  This would mark the first criminal charges against Trump's company since prosecutors began investigating it three years ago. https://t.co/gRGNkPbhld  NBC News confirms: Two representatives of the Trump Organization tell NBC News they've been told to expect charges to be filed against the Trump Organization as soon as tomorrow afternoon. @NBCNews @MSNBC  WaPo now confirms: Prosecutors have told attorneys for Trump's business that both the company and CFO Allen Weisselberg are likely to be indicted on Thursday according to two people familiar with the charges.The charges will focus on unpaid taxes.https://t.co/Blv4In2UFd
